org.safs.selenium.webdriver.lib.model

Class DefaultRefreshable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.safs.selenium.webdriver.lib.model.DefaultRefreshable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRefreshable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Component, Element

    public class DefaultRefreshable
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRefreshable
    History:

    Jun 12, 2014 (Lei Wang) Initial release.
    Nov 05, 2014 (Lei Wang) Modify refresh(): if the 'id' is not null and we cannot get object by id, then stop searching. if we cannot get fresh-webelement, we will not update fields like id, tagname etc.
    FEB 25, 2016 (Lei Wang) Modify refresh(): log a warning message instead of throwing out an Exception if we cannot get webelement by id. Modify searchWebElement(): Use WebDriver as SearchContext to find the object, if it cannot be found with given SearchContext.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.String cssClass
      cssClass is the html css value for this web element, it may be null
      protected java.lang.String id
      id is the html id for this web element, it may be null
      protected java.util.Map<?,?> map
      The convenient reference to embedded element object.
      protected java.lang.Object object
      The wrapped object, represents a control object on the web application
      This object is refreshable, which means it can be reset if the control object
      of web application has changed its status.
      For now, 2 kinds of type can be accepted, Map returned from a javascript fucntion;
      WebElement returned by Selenium WebDriver (with certain search criterion).
      protected java.lang.String[] possibleRecognitionStrings
      possibleRecognitionStrings is used to refresh the WebElement, it may be null.
      protected org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext searchContext
      searchContext is used to refresh the WebElement according to id, tag, cssclass etc, it may be null
      protected java.lang.String tagName
      tagName is the html tag name for this web element, should never be null
      protected org.openqa.selenium.WebElement webelement
      The convenient reference to embedded element object.
      This element may become stale, see stale_element
      If the element is stale, we need to refresh it by getting it again (by id or css or other ways)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected DefaultRefreshable()
      Counstructor ONLY for subclass, cannot be used to create an instance outside.
        DefaultRefreshable(java.lang.Object object)
      Constructor used to create an uniformed DefaultRefreshable object.
      User may override this one to parse their own object, if there are some new attritues
      to analyze, then user should override updateFields() and he MUST TAKE CARE:
      in the overrided constructor, DO NOT forget to call updateFields() after calling
      super(object), below is an exmaple of implementation in subclass.

      org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext getSearchContext()
      searchContext is used to find the WebElement according to id, tag, cssclass etc, it may be null.
      if it is null, SearchObject.getWebDriver() will be used a SearchContext.
      if it is not null, it may be stale itself!
      java.lang.String getTagName()
      get the WebElement's Tag Name.

      Try to get the Selenium WebElement object 'webelement', if is null then try to find it by id.
      It can be used to verify the status.

      Refresh the webelement by its 'ID' or 'CSS CLASS' or preset 'Recognition Strings'.
      And update the value of fields according to the refreshed-WebElement
      void setCssClass(java.lang.String cssClass) 
      void setId(java.lang.String id)

      void setWebElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
      set the embedded WebElement object.
      protected void updateFields()
      set/update the class's local fields through the underlying WebElement.
      Especially after calling refresh(boolean), the underlying WebElement may have been
      refreshed, and the associated attributes may have different value, it is recommanded
      to call this method to update the class's local field.

    • Field Detail

      • object

        protected java.lang.Object object
        The wrapped object, represents a control object on the web application
        This object is refreshable, which means it can be reset if the control object
        of web application has changed its status.
        For now, 2 kinds of type can be accepted, Map returned from a javascript fucntion;
        WebElement returned by Selenium WebDriver (with certain search criterion). There are convinient
        references for them, map and webelement.
        For now, Only WebElement can be refreshed by method refresh(boolean).

      • map

        protected java.util.Map<?,?> map
        The convenient reference to embedded element object.

      • webelement

        protected org.openqa.selenium.WebElement webelement
        The convenient reference to embedded element object.
        This element may become stale, see stale_element
        If the element is stale, we need to refresh it by getting it again (by id or css or other ways)
        See Also:
        refresh(boolean)

      • tagName

        protected java.lang.String tagName
        tagName is the html tag name for this web element, should never be null

      • id

        protected java.lang.String id
        id is the html id for this web element, it may be null

      • cssClass

        protected java.lang.String cssClass
        cssClass is the html css value for this web element, it may be null

      • searchContext

        protected org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext searchContext
        searchContext is used to refresh the WebElement according to id, tag, cssclass etc, it may be null

      • possibleRecognitionStrings

        protected java.lang.String[] possibleRecognitionStrings
        possibleRecognitionStrings is used to refresh the WebElement, it may be null. Example as "id=xxx", "text=xxx" etc.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultRefreshable

        protected DefaultRefreshable()
        Counstructor ONLY for subclass, cannot be used to create an instance outside.

      • DefaultRefreshable

        public DefaultRefreshable(java.lang.Object object)
        Constructor used to create an uniformed DefaultRefreshable object.
        User may override this one to parse their own object, if there are some new attritues
        to analyze, then user should override updateFields() and he MUST TAKE CARE:
        in the overrided constructor, DO NOT forget to call updateFields() after calling
        super(object), below is an exmaple of implementation in subclass.
         super(object);
 updateFields();
        The reason is that all fields will be initialized after calling super() or this() in a constructor.
        This is a nature of Java Language. So even here we call updateFields() to set value for
        some fields of sub-class during instantiation of sub-class which overrides method updateFields(),
        but after calling of super(object) in the constructor of sub-class, all fields of sub-class will be
        initialized to the default value; What is set HERE will be LOST!!!
        Or there is a better way, in the sub class's constructor user just need to call initialize(Object).
        in that constructor, the no-parameter constructor DefaultRefreshable() will be called implicitly,
        and the fileds of subclass will be initialized, then the method initialize(Object) will be called,
        no fileds of subclass will be reinitialized!
        But we should NEVER do anything except calling initialize(Object) in the constructor, the reason is
        that the no-parameter constructor will be called in subclass's constructor, and everything we added here will
        not be visible for constructor in subclass. We MUST do that work in the method initialize(Object) or updateFields()
        Parameters:
        object - Object, the element object. It may be a Map returned from javascript; it may be a WebElement.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected void initialize(java.lang.Object object)
        Set the embedded object and update the component's fields.
        Parameters:
        object -

      • updateFields

        protected void updateFields()
        set/update the class's local fields through the underlying WebElement.
        Especially after calling refresh(boolean), the underlying WebElement may have been
        refreshed, and the associated attributes may have different value, it is recommanded
        to call this method to update the class's local field.
        See Also:
        refresh(boolean)

        public org.openqa.selenium.WebElement getWebElement()

        It can be used to verify the status.

        public org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext getSearchContext()

        if it is not null, it may be stale itself!

      • refresh

        public boolean refresh(boolean checkStale)
        Refresh the webelement by its 'ID' or 'CSS CLASS' or preset 'Recognition Strings'.
        And update the value of fields according to the refreshed-WebElement
        Specified by:
        refresh in interface IRefreshable
        Parameters:
        checkStale - boolean, whether to check if the webelement is stable before refresh. true, check stable; false, force refresh directly without check.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the refresh succeed.
